article.headline: Boise State 69, San Francisco 58
article.story: TEMPE, Ariz. (AP) -- Coby Karl scored 20 points to lead Boise State past San Francisco 69-58 in Thursday night's consolation game of the ASU Hoops Classic. Eric Lane had 13 points, including a 3-pointer with 12:14 left that put the Broncos (6-4) ahead to stay at 48-46. Boise State made 10 straight free throws in the final 2:39 to secure the win, its third in the last four games. Danny Cavic had 18 points off the bench for the Dons (4-8), who have lost three straight. Cavic made five 3-pointers in seven attempts before fouling out. San Francisco's Armondo Surratt added 13 points and seven assists and Alan Wiggins had 11 points and 11 rebounds. The Dons led 34-31 at halftime but then missed 10 of 12 shots over an eight-minute span as Boise State stretched its lead to 57-50 with 4:59 remaining. San Francisco never got closer than four the rest of the way.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
